alert.note: Alert for Greater Lake Tahoe Area (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 19 at 5:43PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT LAKE TAHOE NEAR EMERALD BAY THROUGH 630 PM PDT... At 541 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Emerald Bay and is nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Heavy rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized runoff and flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Locations impacted include... Emerald Bay, Bliss State Park, Meeks Bay, and Fallen Leaf Campground. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If on or near Lake Tahoe, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
